textos_fuente.text: Downtown SLC cocktail bar unleashes Western-themed re-design ‚Äì Gastronomic Salt Lake City Skip to content Gastronomic Salt Lake City Utah's oldest food magazine. Call us (385) 429-0650 About Subscribe Best Of SLC 2025 Dining Guide News Industry Search for... Gastronomic Salt Lake City Utah's oldest food magazine. Call us (385) 429-0650 Navigation Menu Navigation Menu About Subscribe Best Of SLC 2025 Dining Guide News Industry Downtown SLC cocktail bar unleashes Western-themed re-design by Stuart Melling April 7, 2025 April 8, 2025 Menu watch , News Flanker Kitchen & Sporting Club It‚Äôs all change again at The Parlor ‚Äì the semi-secret cocktail lounge tucked away at the back of Flanker.    The latest revamp follows the similarly over the top 1980s themed Tipsy Flamingo .  Now known as the Hidden Boot Saloon, the latest refresh draws inspiration from Western flair.  The design is a mix of modern and classic ‚Äì murals of icons such as Johnny Cash and Dolly Parton sit alongside the likes of Jelly Roll. As ever, the interior design is an impeccable, no expense spared effort ‚Äì thematic apropos decoration stretches from the jail-cell entry doorway, through to the country-themed glassware.  Heck, there‚Äôs even a mechanical bull should you wish to saddle up and show your skills. Flanker ‚Äì mechanical bull (Gastronomic SLC) Flanker ‚Äì interior design refresh (Gastronomic SLC) Francesco Lafranconi, VP of beverage and hospitality for the larger group writes,  ‚ÄúAt Flanker we pride ourselves on curating immersive experiences that bring our locals together, and our latest pop-up, the Hidden Boot Saloon, is no exception. This experience is a true celebration of cowboy culture, filled with lively music, expertly crafted drinks, and an energetic atmosphere. From the moment you walk through the swinging doors, you‚Äôll feel the Western spirit and know you are in for an exciting, unforgettable evening.‚Äù Alongside the visual refresh, the food and cocktail menu has also been suitably updated. As I sipped through a few of Lafranconi‚Äôs latest cocktails, I ordered up the seemingly innocuous pigs in blankets. The pastry-wrapped hot links arrived resplendent in a grand trophy. Winner winner, err, sausage dinner. It‚Äôs these little humourous twists and turns that ensure the experience always offers something new to discover. And well, frankly, it‚Äôs just fun. The Hidden Boot Saloon is expected to stay open throughout the summer ‚Äì with a variety of western-themed events and specials planned through the lounge‚Äôs run.  Be sure to follow Flanker‚Äôs socials for the latest news.  Reservations to drink and dine can be made online with the bar open Wed-Thu, 5.00 ‚Äì 10.00 p.m. and Fri-Sat, 5.00 p.m. ‚Äì 1.00 a.m. Scion Cider Bar ‚Äì interior Scion Cider The latest house-made cider is now on tap at this Central 9th spot. Crafted by fine fermenter (remember cider is wine folks) Rio Connelly, the latest release (named EDNA) is also available in cans to go. The bar writes that the release is, ‚Äúan off-dry sour cider made from 100% WA-grown Columbia Crabapple w/ big tartness, soft tannins, hints of tropical fruit & spice, and seriously session-able at 5.5% ABV.‚Äù You can also find a new superfood-powered concoction detailed as ‚Äúsemi-sweet unfiltered cider w/ papaya, a√ßai berry & local honey, fruity, tropical & lightly tart coming in at 6.2% ABV. Also available in cans to-go tonight for your spring skiing adventures this weekend!‚Äù Bambara You may recall that chef JV Hernandez recently took the reigns at this restaurant in the Hotel Monaco in downtown SLC. The latest update following the kitchen retooling is the launch of an all-new brunch menu. The restaurant writes that: . . . To start, guests can indulge in an exciting selection of sharable bites, including Blue Cheese Potato Chips made with a tantalizing blend of rich jack cheese and creamy blue cheese, and perfectly seasoned with a bold harissa spice for a touch of heat. For those who lean into the sweeter side of the menu, guests can share the delicately fried Ricotta Donuts that are complemented by smooth champagne-infused dulce de leche drizzle. For a more savory experience, guests can try a menu item that has a delightful twist on classic flavors. The Pastrami Salmon Toast, featuring cured salmon on top of perfectly toasted bread, is enhanced with a smooth muhammara spread and garnished with everything spice and fresh herbs for a bold and flavorful bite. If that sounds exciting, guests who want an even bolder flavor can order the Birria Egg Benedict that highlights a fusion of savory flavors on top of a Salt City English Muffin. A drizzle of zesty chipotle lime hollandaise covers the poached eggs and tender, slow-braised birria, for a perfect bite each time. Sugar House Station ‚Äì gyro by Greek Tyrant (Gastronomic SLC) Sugar House Station The methodical opening of vendors at this new Sugar House spot has been continuing at a brisk pace.  By my reckoning the full slate are now in action at the food hall.  Joining the launch names (Bird House Chicken, Proper Burger, Canella‚Äôs), three new bars by Sugar House Distillery, Casot, and Waterpocket Distillery have revved into gear. In the last few days, Santo Tacos, Pizza Bar, Publik, and Greek Tyrant have all joined in on the fun too.  Pictured above is the gyro by Greek Tyrant ‚Äì a concept by former Aristo‚Äôs owner and chef, Aristides Boutsikakis.   If you missed it, here‚Äôs my original preview of the food and drink hall opening just a few weeks ago. The Salt Republic A new seasonal menu is now available at this restaurant on the ground floor of the downtown Hyatt Regency Hotel.  The PR team tells me: . . . The dinner menu offers delectable options for every palate, from the lighter flavors of Sweet Corn Soup, or the local foliage and fresh berries in the Mountain Berry Salad, to heartier options such as Fire Grilled Elk, Spring Bucatini, and the Wagyu Pastrami Smash Burger. For lunch, delight in midday specialties such as Burrata Toast with pickled cherry pepper relish, Fried Oyster Mushrooms with a Korean chili aioli and pickled serrano peppers, Beet Salad with whipped chevre and candied pecans and a twist on luncheon classics like the Grilled Chicken Club on focaccia with pesto aioli and bacon. And for dessert, enjoy a Seasonal Cookie Skillet a la mode or something fruit-forward like the Morello Cherry Tart with dark chocolate ganache. Small bites Kona Grill ‚Äì A special menu through April 17th will include: Spicy Tuna Taco ‚Äì Crispy nori, spicy motoyaki, and spring onion, $24 Stuffed Salmon ‚Äì Brie and crab filling, sesame broccoli, yellow rice, and a decadent butter cream sauce, $39 Seafood Fettuccine Alfredo ‚Äì Shrimp, bay scallops, mussels, creamy Alfredo sauce, parmesan, and scallions, $39 Mazza ‚Äì Ted Scheffler in Utah Stories reported that Ali Sabbah‚Äôs award-winning Lebanese eatery will offer special lunches every Friday, 11.00 ‚Äì 2.00. The menu includes three sandwiches with one side of hummus, salad or fries, and a drink of your choice. This will be pick-up only along with needing to pre-order by 9:00 am on Fridays.‚Äù STK ‚Äì A ‚ÄúBounty from the Seven Seas‚Äù limited-time menu available through April 17th includes: Duck & Shuck, two oysters aguachile paired with a glass of Decoy by Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc, $26 New England Clam Chowder, $17 Spicy Yellowtail Crispy Rice, pickled Fresno and unagi sauce, $27 Grilled Octopus, fingerling potatoes, salsa verde, olives, and smoked paprika aioli, $34 Surf & Turf Fried Rice, wagyu beef, crab, spicy motoyaki, and a fried egg, $41 Purchase a subscription Subscribe to our paid newsletter for $5 and help keep our stories free of automated advertising Subscribe Now Other useful links Free newsletter ‚Äì signup and receive our weekly newsletter for free Food talk group ‚Äì chew the fat with other like-minded Utah foodies over on Facebook. Best of SLC 2024 ‚Äì what you can‚Äôt miss in the Beehive right now. Stuart Melling Hi, I‚Äôm Stuart, nice to meet you! ¬†I‚Äôm the founder, writer and wrangler at Gastronomic SLC. ¬†I‚Äôm a multiple-award winning journalist and have written in myopic detail about the Salt Lake City ¬†dining scene for the better part of seventeen years. I‚Äôve worked extensively with multiple local publications from Visit Salt Lake to Salt Lake Magazine, not least helped to consult on national TV. ¬† Pause those credits, yep, that‚Äôs me! I‚Äôm also a former restaurant critic of more than five years, working for the Salt Lake Tribune. ¬† ¬†I‚Äôm largely fueled by a critical obsession with rice, alliteration and the use of big words I don‚Äôt understand. ¬† What they‚Äôre saying about me: ‚ÄúNot inaccurate‚Äù, ‚ÄúI thought he was older‚Äù, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt share his feelings‚Äù. Want to know more? This is why I am the way I am . This article may contain content provided by one of our paid partners. These are some of the best businesses in Utah.    For a list of all our current and past relationships see our partnership history page . Just let us know your vision and Tipsy Tampa will build the board of your wildest dreams. Perfect for an effortless cocktail hour, a glamorous dessert station, or even a full dinner option! Learn More Want to add a charcuterie board to your event? Click through to see pricing! Find out more About Tipsy Tampa Bartender and Events Why Tipsy? Our Philosophy Our Philosophy At Tipsy Tampa Bartender and Events, we are passionate about serving the best drinks in town. Our team of experienced and skilled bartenders work hard to create cocktails that are not only delicious but also visually stunning. We take pride in sourcing the freshest ingredients and using premium spirits to give you an unforgettable drinking experience. Our Philosophy Our Philosophy Our Philosophy We believe that a great cocktail goes beyond just the taste. It should also be an experience that engages all your senses. From the aroma to the presentation, we strive to create drinks that are as visually stunning as they are delicious. Our goal is to provide you with an environment where you can relax, unwind and enjoy the art of mixology. Our Team Our Philosophy Our Team Our team of bartenders are passionate, creative and knowledgeable. They are constantly experimenting with new techniques and ingredients to create exciting new cocktails. With years of experience behind the bar, they can also recommend the perfect drink to suit your tastes and preferences. About Us About Tipsy Tampa Welcome to Tipsy Tampa! I am Chelsea Lopez, the head bartender and owner. I have been bartending in restaurants and bars for 15 years, and wanted to take my passion and bring it to Tampa Bay and my South Florida community. I have been very fortunate to be a part of so many amazing weddings and events in the Tampa Bay area since Tipsy Tampa started in 2017. We have recently expanded to Miami, Ft. Lauderdale and the Palm Beaches as well as Orlando and Central Florida. Look around the site to learn more about what we do and how we can help make your special day memorable! Pricing & Packages Why tipsy tampa? At Tipsy Tampa, we aim to make this part of your wedding planning a breeze. We work with any budget, any drink preference and any venue type. All of our amazing clients will say we are affordable, flexible and go above and beyond on to make your day memorable! Reviews Meet Our Regional Coordinators A Team To Meet All Your FL Wedding Needs In 2020-2024 Tipsy Tampa had its most successful years EVER with hundreds of upcoming bookings in 2026 and beyond. That's why we've assembled an expert team to meet all of your Florida wedding needs. With the addition of Abby and Gladys as coordinators, Tipsy Tampa is proud to say we cover North Central , South AND Central Florida as well as Sarasota , Bradenton , Fort Myers , and the Palm Beaches . Read on to find your regional coordinator and start making your wedding dreams come to life! Leigha Rybnick - Lead bartender Meet Leigha! Leigha is a TIPSY TAMPA FAVE! She has been in the industry for over 25 years and it shows through her work ethic. Guests love her, we love her, and her drinks are delicious! Book a Consult With Leigha Ashley Price As a regular Tipsy Team member, Ashley learned exactly what it means to throw the perfect party! She brings that knowledge and SO much more to her position as Tipsy's assistant coordinator! You may see her bartending, serving, coordinating because really she does is ALL! Book a Consult With Ashley Kelly Mahaney  - planner - coordinator Kelly has been in planning for years. She is so knowledgeable and knows how to throw the best party. Kelly also offers amazing bridal party options! bridalbashsoflo.com Book a Consult With Kelly Abigail Kay Silva - ASSISTANT Abigail is a Florida native so she was born into the party. With a ton of party planning experience and the perfect personality she was a natural fit. She brings the TIPSY to the TAMPA and the guests love her so much. ¬†Ask Abby any questions and she is sure to help you figure out exactly what is needed for the perfect event. Jamie Haughn Jamie is just awesome. She started with us in 2023 and has been nothing short of amazing. With her 20 years in the business she shakes things up everyday! Whether you're easing into happy hour or riding the late-night wave, Tipsy Flamingo serves up bold cocktails, feel-good music, and a Miami vibe that never misses. Late Night Happy Hour Thu-Sat | 1AM‚ÄîClose $4 beer & wine, $5 mixed drinks, $7 classics and shots ‚Äî every Thu‚ÄìSat from 1AM to close. Late nights hit different at Tipsy. Book your event! If you're planning a birthday party, bachelorette party, office happy hour, or just a good ol' get-together, Tipsy Flamingo offers custom private event packages. Tap the button below to inquire about hosting your event with us! The Main Bar Tipsy Flamingo is an intimate venue, perfect for events with 100 guests or less. The space lends itself to more informal gatherings, such as cocktail receptions, happy hours, bachelor/bachelorette parties, and more. Our focus is to provide our guests with a fun yet professional atmosphere anchored by our delicious cocktails, quality music, and excellent service. We offer open bar packages, drink tickets, and custom event packages based on your needs. For more information, tap the button below! Fill out the form!
